description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Secure Channel spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-43550):

1. Ensure your system is on a supported build of Windows 10 or Windows 11 as outlined below.
2. Apply the appropriate KB update for your version of Windows using the links provided.
3. Restart your system to finalize the installation and correct any impacted secure channel settings.

**Details**:
- This update resolves issues related to improper certificate validation, which could lead to a spoofing risk.
- Ensure you are using one of the following builds:
  - Windows 11 Version 24H2: 10.0.26100.2033 (KB5044284)
  - Windows 11 Version 23H2: 10.0.22631.4317 (KB5044285)
  - Windows 11 Version 22H2: 10.0.22621.4317 (KB5044285)
  - Windows 11 Version 21H2: 10.0.22000.3260 (KB5044280)
  - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.10240.20796 (KB5044286)
- Update packages can be downloaded from:
  - [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
  - [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
  - [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)
  - [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
  - [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)

**Preconditions**:
- Verify your system’s version matches the supported build numbers listed.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the updates.
